inclusion.criterion: Primary diagnosis: eating disorder according to DSM IV Criteria based on diagnostic interview
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Participated in at least three failed specialized eating disorder treatments
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Having the mental capacity to make provide informed consent to research participation
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The patient is a 15 year old girl with the history of recurrent bilateral headache.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The attacks come 2 times or more per week and each episode lasts around a day or a half.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The pain is pulsating in quality and severe in intensity, causing trouble in her routine physical activity.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The attacks are associated with nausea and photophobia.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: She recently noticed that that there are more attacks around her menstrual period.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: She is diagnosed with the migraine headache and is under treatment.
inclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has a history of recurrent bilateral headache, but it is not an eating disorder. She is somatically stable.
